page.title: 18Kingsbury 1900-1930.
page.content: {SCHOOL.}Many of the children walked long distances to school along rough roads which were swept on Saturdays. The children marched into school,and after assembly marched to their lessons which were mainly of Reading, Writing,Arithmetic and Singing.The infants used slates to write on. Children who couldn't get home for lunch brought sandwiches which had to be eaten in an open shed outside. {SHOPS.}In Kingsbury there were two grocers,a clothing,boot shop and sweet shop,a salt fish shop,a general provi- sion shop,a butchers, a saddlers and cycle shop,and two bakers.Only the two grocers and the cycle shop remain. {GLOVING.}This was done by women in their homes.A lady agent of Whitbys of Yeovil took completed work by horse and cart to Martock station on Fridays and from there by train to Yeovil.
